sn2.30:15.1: The celebration of Namuci’s defeat by Māṇavagāmiya is a striking verbal allusion to Rig Veda 5.30.7c, where the defeat of Namuci opened the way for “the progress of Manu” (manave gātum, Rig Veda 5.30.7c), i.e. the spread of the Aryan peoples who were Manu’s children. Reading Pali gāmiya as a secondary derivation from gama, “going”, yields the sense, “The Progress of Manu’s Children”. Here the term can have the Buddhist sense of the path of the Aryans.
